definition: to think for oneself and act accordingly (idiom); to act on one's own initiative
self/oneself/from/since/naturally/surely
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works

sentences.english: You're the shrink. I'm not big on self-affirmation.
sentences.chinese: 你纔是心理醫生，我纔不會那麼自作主張。

sentences.english: Brook It implies self-assertion and defiance.
Lightman : You're the shrink . I'm not big on self- affirmation.
sentences.chinese: 你纔是心理醫生，我纔不會那麼自作主張。

sentences.english: For some reason, this attendant bought the horse's bones with half of the gold he took.
sentences.chinese: 侍臣自作主張用五百兩黃金買了死馬的馬骨。

sentences.english: Bennigsen, on his own responsibility, ordered the troops to be moved on to the high-road.
sentences.chinese: 貝尼格森自作主張，命令把軍隊都轉移到高地上去。

sentences.english: Jade home woke up and found wei macro self-assertion, were passed out again.
sentences.chinese: 玉家醒來，發現偉宏自作主張，被氣得又再昏倒。

sentences.english: Cui Xiuya daughter very worried so self-assertion, to filial piety back South Korea.
sentences.chinese: 崔秀雅非常擔心女兒於是自作主張將孝恩接回了韓國。

sentences.english: Youth Self assertion, because small mistakes and blunders.
sentences.chinese: 青年自作主張，會因爲小失誤而犯大錯。

money for a voyage/travel expenses
to twine/to coil
conclusion/judgment/verdict
virtue has its rewards (idiom); one good turn deserves another
authority over the household
rigorous schemes and deep foresight (idiom); astute and circumspect
Trouble issues from the mouth (idiom). A loose tongue may cause a lot of trouble.
forged book/book of dubious authenticity/misattributed book/Apocrypha
unexpected misfortune/unexpected accident/sudden death
(Buddhism) retribution/karma
to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about
evil has its retribution (idiom); to suffer the consequences of one's bad deeds/sow the wind and reap the whirlwind (Hosea 8:7)
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
